document.docAuthor: Xue, Xiao-Feng, Song, Zi-Wei & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Six new species of Rhyncaphytoptinae from northwestern China (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species of Rhyncaphytoptinae from northwestern China (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Rhyncaphytoptus
from China

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Prodorsal shield smooth
............................................... Rhyncaphytoptus ziziphi
Kuang

4 Median and submedian lines separate
................... Rhyncaphytoptus mori
Liu & Kuang

5 Prodorsal shield with many dashes, setae
h 1
present
.. Rhyncaphytoptus fabris
sp. nov.

8 Coxal area with short lines, median line absent.
Rhyncaphytoptus illicis Kuang & Luo

keyStep.keyLead:
9 Median and admedian lines on prodorsal shield connected by transverse line, empo­ dium 5 ­rayed, solenidion knobbed
............ Rhyncaphytoptus taihangensis
Xue & Hong

paragraph.keyLead: ­ Median and admedian lines on prodorsal shield separate, empodium 6 ­rayed, solenid­

subSubSection.paragraph:
ion tapered
.................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus papyriferae
Xue & Hong
10 Prodorsal shield smooth
.................................... Rhyncaphytoptus cotoneasteri
sp. nov.

paragraph.keyLead:
­ Prodorsal shield with median, admedian and submedian lines, scapular setae ( sc ) mod­ erate long
................................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus fargesii
sp. nov.

15 Scapular tubercles on rear shield margin, paraxial tibial setae ( l’ ) located 1 / 3 from dor­ sal base
.................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus lushanensis
Kuang & Zhao

­ Scapular tubercles ahead of rear shield margin, paraxial tibial setae ( l’ ) located 2 / 3 from dorsal base
........................................... Rhyncaphytoptus microstegii
Wei & Feng

16 Setae
h 1
present.............................................
Rhyncaphytoptus betulae Kuang & Hong

17 Scapular setae ( sc ) projecting posterior
.......................... Rhyncaphytoptus boczeki
Hall

19 Median and admedian lines connected at basal 1 / 3 and 2 / 3 , empodium 6 to 7 ­rayed ....
................................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus zhongshani
Zhao & Kuang

21 Scapular setae ( sc ) projecting posterior, median and admedian lines connected at basal 2 / 3
........................................................................ Rhyncaphytoptus cryptomerus
Huang

­ Scapular setae ( sc ) projecting forward, median and admedian lines connected at basal 1 / 3 and 2 / 3
....................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus acer
Chen, Wei & Qin

22 Setae
h 1
absent
.............................................. Rhyncaphytoptus ipomoeae
Kuang & Shi
­ Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles, empodium 5 ­rayed .................................... 24

­ Median line obscure on prodorsal shield................
Rhyncaphytoptus ulmi Xin & Dong

25 Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles on rear annular margins, submedian lines incomplete
............................................. Rhyncaphytoptus caricae
Zhao & Kuang

­ Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles ahead of rear annular margins, submedian lines complete
.................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus hangzhouensis
Kuang
